channel.title: Points
channel.description: well i was just on planetrenders and i thought it would be could to have a points system like theres. e.g for every post you do your get 2 points for every topic you make you get 5 points? and you need a certian amout of points to post in places like you need 50 points to post in the question catagory ect... good idea? or bad?

item.title: Points
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

[quote=“io9, post:13, topic:74797”][quote author=lothy link=topic=109843.msg1100879#msg1100879 date=1175869718]

bad, leads to spam/restriction of categories that should not be restricted for new talent

It does more then that though. Quite frankly, it pisses me off when I go onto a forum for the first time and want to visit a section, only to find that I’m 20 - 50 posts short.
Forget restricting people, it can turn a lot of people off the forums entirely.

EDIT: Fixed a typo. :o
[/quote]
Maybe it’ll make moparscapers go off, like put 15 posts in the questions section and 3 for general Discussion[/quote]
You can’t look at it from that point of view. You need to see people as ‘people with potential’, or ‘people who are just here for fun’, or ‘people that lack potential’. I’m sure you can find a single word to replace the ‘people that lack potential’. :rolleyes:

Basically, putting post requirements on a section is potentially shutting out a person with the brain of Stephen Hawking or Einstein. It’s not a good thing to do.
Regarding members from Moparscape: some post here when they first join, but most don’t. There’s a few posts a week? Compare that to the amount of account registrations per week.
I for one followed all of the rules from day one, which can be seen by reading the very first of my posts, so don’t jump the gun and throw everyone who uses a particular website into one basket.
